tkscrollableframe.scrollbar_type_enum module

This module holds an enum class that defines the types of scrollbars that can be used in the ScrollableFrame class.

class tkscrollableframe.scrollbar_type_enum.ScrollbarsType(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)[source]

Bases: Enum

An enum class that defines the types of scrollbars that can be used

tkscrollableframe.widget module

Implementation of the scrollable frame widget.

class tkscrollableframe.widget.ScrolledFrame(master: Tk, scrollbars: ScrollbarsType = ScrollbarsType.BOTH, use_scroll_wheel: bool = True, use_arrow_keys: bool = False, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Frame

Scrollable Frame widget.

Use display_widget() to set the interior widget. For example, to display a Label with the text “Hello, world!”, you can say:

sf = ScrolledFrame(self) sf.pack() sf.display_widget(Label, text=”Hello, world!”)

You may probably want to put an inner frame inside the ScrolledFrame

The constructor accepts the usual Tkinter keyword arguments, plus a handful of its own:

scrollbars (str; default: “both”)

Which scrollbars to provide. Must be one of “vertical”, “horizontal,” “both”, or “neither”.

use_ttk (bool; default: False)

Whether to use ttk widgets if available. The default is to use standard Tk widgets. This setting has no effect if ttk is not available on your system.
